docs.snippet: The congressman joins a growing list of House members calling it quits, despairing of political gridlock....
docs.lead_paragraph: The congressman joins a growing list of House members calling it quits, despairing of political gridlock.
docs.abstract: Rep Henry A Waxman of California announces that he will retire at the end of 2014; Waxman has served 40 years in the House, and joins growing list of House members who are calling it quits.

headline.main: Henry Waxman, Key Democrat and Force for Health Care Law, Is to Retire

docs.snippet: The sports marketing extravaganza has marked the re-emergence of the familiar wisecracking, boastful and emotive Chris Christie after weeks of grimaces and apologies....
docs.lead_paragraph: The sports marketing extravaganza has marked the re-emergence of the familiar wisecracking, boastful and emotive Chris Christie after weeks of grimaces and apologies.
docs.abstract: Run-up to Super Bowl has New Jersey Gov Chris Christie back to his familiar wisecracking, boastful and emotive self, following weeks of grimaces and apologies in wake of George Washington Bridge scandal.

headline.main: For Christie, a Governor Under Fire, Super Bowl Brings Glee
headline.print_headline: For Governor Under Fire, Big Game Brings Glee

docs.snippet: Under a law passed after emergency workers distributed knockoff clothing to Hurricane Katrina refugees, the government cannot give away counterfeit clothing it seizes....
docs.lead_paragraph: Under a law passed after emergency workers distributed knockoff clothing to Hurricane Katrina refugees, the government cannot give away counterfeit clothing it seizes.
docs.abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column; 202,000 items seized by federal agents in recent weeks for having bogus National Football League trademarks are set to be destroyed, despite calls that clothing could be put to better use for those in need; government cannot given away counterfeit clothing it seizes, under law passed after emergency workers distributed knockoff clothing to Hurricane Katrina refugees.

docs.snippet: If the Super Bowl comes down a last-second field goal, might as well head for the fridge. If your team has the ball, the question is not whether it's going to be good — it will — but whether to pop the cork on that bottle of champagne ...
docs.lead_paragraph: If the Super Bowl comes down a last-second field goal, might as well head for the fridge. If your team has the ball, the question is not whether it's going to be good — it will — but whether to pop the cork on that bottle of champagne you've been saving for some big occasion.

headline.main: In Year of Kicker, Best 2 Meet in Super Bowl
headline.print_headline: In Year of Kicker, Best 2 Meet in Super Bowl

docs.snippet: The U.S. intelligence chief, James Clapper, said this week that the loss of state secrets as a result of leaks by former National Security Agency analyst Edward Snowden was the worst in American history. Clapper backed up his assertion with dire f...
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. intelligence chief, James Clapper, said this week that the loss of state secrets as a result of leaks by former National Security Agency analyst Edward Snowden was the worst in American history. Clapper backed up his assertion with dire forecasts about emboldened enemies abroad, but some historians and researchers said the U.S. has struggled with even more devastating intelligence breakdowns over the past century.

headline.main: FACT CHECK: NSA Leaks Worst Intelligence Breach?
headline.print_headline: FACT CHECK: NSA Leaks Worst Intelligence Breach?
